member.summary: Updates the authenticating user's profile background image. This method expects raw multipart data, not a URL to an image. Must be a valid GIF, JPG, or PNG image of less than 800 kilobytes in size. Images with width larger than 2048 pixels will be scaled down.

member.summary:
When this configuration option is called, the query request is sent via the specified proxy URL, rather than directly to Twitter.
Currently, the .NET default of using the Internet Explorer defined proxy as a default for all outgoing requests is in place, but may change before the version 1.0 release.
member.param: The URL of a proxy to use

member.returns: The current position in the fluent expression

member.summary: Provides methods for converting structures to and from the equivalent RFC 3339 string representation.

member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent.
member.param: A string containing a date and time to convert.
member.returns: A equivalent to the date and time contained in .
member.remarks: The string is parsed using formatting information in the object.
member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
does not contain a valid RFC 3339 string representation of a date and time.

member.name: M:TweetSharp.Model.Yammer.Converters.YammerDateConverter.Rfc3339DateTime.ToString(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts the value of the specified object to its equivalent string representation.
member.param: The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) to convert.
member.returns: A RFC 3339 string representation of the value of the .

remarks.para: This method returns a string representation of the that is precise to the three most significant digits of the seconds fraction; that is, it represents the milliseconds in a date and time value.

While it is possible to display higher precision fractions of a second component of a time value, that value may not be meaningful. The precision of date and time values depends on the resolution of the system clock. On Windows NT 3.5 and later, and Windows Vista operating systems, the clock's resolution is approximately 10-15 milliseconds.

member.exception: The specified object does not represent a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) value.

member.name: M:TweetSharp.Model.Yammer.Converters.YammerDateConverter.Rfc3339DateTime.TryParse(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a date and time to its equivalent.
member.param: A string containing a date and time to convert.

When this method returns, contains the value equivalent to the date and time contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or MinValue if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), or does not contain a valid string representation of a date and time. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The string is parsed using formatting information in the object.

member.name: P:TweetSharp.Service.TwitterSearchOptions.Location
member.summary:
Returns tweets by users located within a given radius of the given latitude/longitude. The location is preferentially taking from the Geotagging API, but will fall back to their Twitter profile.
You cannot use the near phrase operator via the API to geocode arbitrary locations but you can use this geocode parameter to search near geocodes directly.

member.name: P:TweetSharp.Service.TwitterSearchOptions.LocationRadiusMiles
member.summary:
Returns tweets by users located within a given radius of the given latitude/longitude. The location is preferentially taking from the Geotagging API, but will fall back to their Twitter profile.
You cannot use the near phrase operator via the API to geocode arbitrary locations but you can use this geocode parameter to search near geocodes directly.

member.name: T:TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo
member.summary: This class provides meta-data for your specific Twitter application, that is used to identify your client to Twitter, store OAuth credentials for all future request, and in some cases define a transparent proxy to redirect API calls to.

member.name: P:TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo.ClientName
member.summary: This is the name of your client application. It is used to identify your client when a user updates their status, or when your application makes a Twitter Search API request.

member.name: P:TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo.ClientVersion
member.summary: This is the version of your application. This is meta-data only, and not used by Twitter for client processing.

member.name: P:TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo.ClientUrl
member.summary: This is the URL of your application. This is meta-data only, and not used by Twitter for client processing. Your application's URL is stored by Twitter when you apply for a 'Source' attribute or register your application for OAuth.

member.name: P:TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo.ConsumerKey
member.summary: If your client is using OAuth authentication, this value should be set to the value of your consumer key. This avoids having to provide the key in every query.

member.name: P:TweetSharp.TwitterClientInfo.ConsumerSecret
member.summary: If your client is using OAuth authentication, this value should be set to the value of your consumer secret. This avoids having to provide the secret in every query.
